Package population

Interface PopulationInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Population
public interface PopulationInterface
PopulationInterface.java This interface defines the methods for managing a population of individuals within a simulation, providing methods to manipulate individuals, change distributions, create copies, and retrieve various statistics and information about the population. Created on 01/06/2024
Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • remove_one_individual

      Boolean remove_one_individual(Integer individual_id)
      Removes a single individual from the population.
      Parameters:
      individual_id - The ID of the individual to be removed.
      Returns:
      True if the individual was successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • remove_individuals

      Boolean remove_individuals(ArrayList<Integer> individual_ids)
      Removes multiple individuals from the population.
      Parameters:
      individual_ids - A list of IDs of the individuals to be removed.
      Returns:
      True if the individuals were successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • remove_all_individuals

      Boolean remove_all_individuals()
      Removes all individuals from the population.
      Returns:
      True if all individuals were successfully removed, false otherwise.

    • change_distribution_of_individual

      Boolean change_distribution_of_individual(Integer individual_id, Integer num_changes)
      Changes the distribution of a single individual.
      Parameters:
      individual_id - The ID of the individual whose distribution is to be changed.
      num_changes - The number of changes to be made to the distribution.
      Returns:
      True if the distribution was successfully changed, false otherwise.

    • change_distribution_of_individuals

      Boolean change_distribution_of_individuals(ArrayList<Pair<Integer,Integer>> individuals_changes)
      Changes the distribution of multiple individuals.
      Parameters:
      individuals_changes - A list of pairs, where each pair contains the ID of the individual and the number of changes to be made to their distribution.
      Returns:
      True if the distributions were successfully changed, false otherwise.

    • create_new_copy_of_individual

      Integer create_new_copy_of_individual(Integer individual_id)
      Creates a new copy of a single individual.
      Parameters:
      individual_id - The ID of the individual to be copied.
      Returns:
      The ID of the newly created copy.

    • create_new_copy_of_individuals

      ArrayList<Integer> create_new_copy_of_individuals(ArrayList<Pair<Integer,Integer>> individuals_changes)
      Creates new copies of multiple individuals.
      Parameters:
      individuals_changes - A list of pairs, where each pair contains the ID of the individual to be copied and the number of copies to be created.
      Returns:
      A list of IDs of the newly created copies.

    • get_population_size

      Integer get_population_size()
      Gets the current population size.
      Returns:
      The size of the population.

    • get_comfort_value

      Float get_comfort_value(Integer individual_id)
      Gets the comfort value of a single individual.
      Parameters:
      individual_id - The ID of the individual whose comfort value is to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The comfort value of the individual.

    • get_comfort_vector

      ArrayList<Pair<Integer,Float>> get_comfort_vector()
      Gets the comfort values for all individuals in the population.
      Returns:
      A list of pairs, where each pair contains the ID of the individual and their comfort value.

    • get_optimal_solution_found

      Boolean get_optimal_solution_found()
      Checks if the optimal solution has been found.
      Returns:
      True if the optimal solution has been found, false otherwise.

    • get_best_individual_values

      Pair<Float,String> get_best_individual_values()
      Gets the best individual values.
      Returns:
      A pair containing the best value and a string representation of the best individual.

    • get_best_individuals_string

      String[] get_best_individuals_string()
      Gets string representations of the best individuals.
      Returns:
      An array of strings, where each string represents one of the best individuals.

    • start_new_epidemic

      ArrayList<Integer> start_new_epidemic()
      Starts a new epidemic within the population. This method triggers the beginning of a new epidemic event in the population simulation.
      Returns:
      An Array with the ids of the individuals that dies during the epidemic

    • get_time_min

      Float get_time_min()
      Gets the minimum time value.
      Returns:
      The minimum time value.
